speaker: KENT
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: KENT
text_entry: SCENE I. The British camp, near Dover.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Enter, with drum and colours, EDMUND, REGAN, Gentlemen, and Soldiers.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Know of the duke if his last purpose hold,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Or whether since he is advised by aught

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To change the course: he's full of alteration

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And self-reproving: bring his constant pleasure.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To a Gentleman, who goes out

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Our sister's man is certainly miscarried.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: 'Tis to be doubted, madam.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Now, sweet lord,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: You know the goodness I intend upon you:

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Tell me--but truly--but then speak the truth,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Do you not love my sister?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: In honour'd love.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: But have you never found my brother's way

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: To the forfended place?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That thought abuses you.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I am doubtful that you have been conjunct

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: And bosom'd with her, as far as we call hers.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: No, by mine honour, madam.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: I never shall endure her: dear my lord,

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Be not familiar with her.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Fear me not:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: She and the duke her husband!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Enter, with drum and colours, ALBANY, GONERIL, and Soldiers

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: [Aside]  I had rather lose the battle than that sister

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Should loosen him and me.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Our very loving sister, well be-met.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Sir, this I hear; the king is come to his daughter,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: With others whom the rigor of our state

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Forced to cry out. Where I could not be honest,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: I never yet was valiant: for this business,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: It toucheth us, as France invades our land,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Not bolds the king, with others, whom, I fear,

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Most just and heavy causes make oppose.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Sir, you speak nobly.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Why is this reason'd?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Combine together 'gainst the enemy;

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: For these domestic and particular broils

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Are not the question here.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Let's then determine

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: With the ancient of war on our proceedings.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I shall attend you presently at your tent.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: Sister, you'll go with us?

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: No.

speaker: REGAN
text_entry: 'Tis most convenient; pray you, go with us.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: [Aside]  O, ho, I know the riddle.--I will go.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: As they are going out, enter EDGAR disguised

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: If e'er your grace had speech with man so poor,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Hear me one word.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: I'll overtake you. Speak.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exeunt all but ALBANY and EDGAR

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Before you fight the battle, ope this letter.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: If you have victory, let the trumpet sound

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: For him that brought it: wretched though I seem,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I can produce a champion that will prove

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: What is avouched there. If you miscarry,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Your business of the world hath so an end,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And machination ceases. Fortune love you.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Stay till I have read the letter.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: I was forbid it.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: When time shall serve, let but the herald cry,

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: And I'll appear again.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Why, fare thee well: I will o'erlook thy paper.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exit EDGAR

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Re-enter EDMUND

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The enemy's in view; draw up your powers.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Here is the guess of their true strength and forces

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: By diligent discovery; but your haste

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Is now urged on you.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: We will greet the time.

speaker: ALBANY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: To both these sisters have I sworn my love;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Each jealous of the other, as the stung

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Are of the adder. Which of them shall I take?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Both? one? or neither? Neither can be enjoy'd,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: If both remain alive: to take the widow

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Exasperates, makes mad her sister Goneril;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And hardly shall I carry out my side,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Her husband being alive. Now then we'll use

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: His countenance for the battle; which being done,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Let her who would be rid of him devise

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: His speedy taking off. As for the mercy

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Which he intends to Lear and to Cordelia,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The battle done, and they within our power,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Shall never see his pardon; for my state

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Stands on me to defend, not to debate.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Exit
